brien

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • brien.Controller

  • public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller.java - the controller class for my entire java fx program. This class manages interactions with the user interface, all other classes, and the database.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private javafx.scene.control.ListView<java.lang.String> chooseProduct
      This ListView is used to hold information about the products that employee's can produce and allow them to select the one they want from the list.
      private javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<java.lang.String> chooseQuantity
      This ComboBox is used to allow the employee to specify how many of a product were created.
      private javafx.scene.control.Label chooseQuantityLabel
      This Label informs the user that the information was saved when they record production and notifies them when they enter an invalid value for the number of products produced.
      private java.sql.Connection conn
      This is the Connection object used by all of the methods that write to or read from the database.
      private Employee currentEmployee
      This field holds the employee account for the employee who is currently logged in.
      private int currentProductionNumber
      This field holds the production number to be used by the next created product.
      private javafx.scene.control.Label currentUserLabel
      This Label is used display the employee who is currently logged in on the employee screen.
      private javafx.scene.control.Label currentUserLabel1
      This Label is used display the employee who is currently logged in on the record production screen.
      private javafx.scene.control.Label currentUserLabel2
      This Label is used display the employee who is currently logged in on the product line screen.
      private javafx.scene.control.Label currentUserLabel3
      This Label is used display the employee who is currently logged in on the production log screen.
      private javafx.scene.control.Label employeeLabel
      This Label is used to display information about the user logging in or creating an account.
      private java.util.ArrayList<Employee> employees
      This ArrayList is used to hold the employees.

      The column for the product ID.

      The column for the product manufacturer.

      The column for the product name.
      private javafx.scene.control.TableColumn<?,?> epColType
      The column for the product item type.
      private javafx.scene.control.TableView<Product> existingProducts
      This TableView is used to display the product that are available to produce.
      private javafx.scene.control.TextField fullNameTextField
      This TextField is used to enter the full name of the employee.
      private int lastId
      This field holds the last product ID used in the program.
      private javafx.collections.ObservableList<Product> observableProductLine
      This ObservableList is used to display the products in the existingProduct TableView.
      private javafx.collections.ObservableList<java.lang.String> observableProductStrings
      This ObservableList is used to display information about the products to the ChooseProduct ListView.
      private javafx.scene.control.PasswordField passwordField
      This PasswordField is used to enter the password for the employee account.
      private javafx.scene.control.TextArea productionLogTextArea
      This TextArea is used to display the production log.
      private java.util.ArrayList<ProductionRecord> productionRecords
      This ArrayList is used to hold the record of production.
      private java.util.ArrayList<Product> productLine
      This ArrayList holds the product that are currently available.
      private javafx.scene.control.Label productLineErrorLabel
      This Label informs the user when they have attempted to enter invalid product details on the Product Line tab.
      private javafx.scene.control.TextField productManufacturer
      This TextField is used to enter the manufacturer of a new product.
      private javafx.scene.control.TextField productName
      This TextField is used to enter the name of a new product.
      private javafx.scene.control.ChoiceBox<ItemType> productType
      This ChoiceBox is used to select the item type of a new product.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void addEmployeeToDatabase(Employee employee)
      This method adds the username, password, and email of an Employee object to the EMPLOYEE table in the database.
      private void addToProductionDB(java.util.ArrayList<ProductionRecord> productionRun)
      This method is used to add a list of production records to the production record database table.
      private void connectToDatabase()
      This method connects to the database and saves that connection object as a field that can be used later.
      void createAccountButtonAction()
      This method runs when the createAccountButton is clicked.
      private void displayCurrentUser()
      This method is used to update the current user labels on all of the different tabs all at once.
      void initialize()
      This method runs when the app is opened and populates the productType and chooseQuantity boxes.
      private void loadEmployees()
      This method is used to load the employees ArrayList with Employee objects created from the EMPLOYEE table in the database.
      private void loadProductionLog()
      This method uses a database connection to get information from the production record and creates ProductionRecord objects from that information.
      private void loadProductLine()
      This method uses a database connection to get the products that are available for production and then adds those products to the observableProductLine ObservableArrayList and the contents of their toString() method to the observableProductStrings ObservableArrayList.
      void loginButtonAction()
      This method runs when the login button is clicked and, if the account details entered by the user are valid, it sets the currentEmployee to be the Employee who is logging in.
      void productionLineButtonAction()
      This method runs when the production line button is clicked and adds the information specified to the database.
      void recordProductionButtonAction()
      This method runs when the record production button is clicked.
      private java.lang.String reversePassword(java.lang.String password)
      This method works recursively to reverse the password that is passed into it and returns the result.
      private void setupProductLineTable()
      This method sets up the existingProducts table and the chooseProduct list and associates them with observable array lists containing the values that they need.
      private void showProduction(java.util.ArrayList<ProductionRecord> productionRun)
      This method displays the production log to the production log text area.
      private static void testMultimedia()
      This is a test class to demonstrate that the AudioPlayer and MoviePlayer classes are working properly.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller()

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        This method runs when the app is opened and populates the productType and chooseQuantity boxes. It them connects to the database and populates the product line arrayList with the data in the database.

      • productionLineButtonAction

        public void productionLineButtonAction()
        This method runs when the production line button is clicked and adds the information specified to the database.

      • recordProductionButtonAction

        public void recordProductionButtonAction()
        This method runs when the record production button is clicked. It adds the results of the production to the database and displays the results on the production log screen.

      • loginButtonAction

        public void loginButtonAction()
        This method runs when the login button is clicked and, if the account details entered by the user are valid, it sets the currentEmployee to be the Employee who is logging in. Otherwise it notifies the user that the entered credentials are not valid.

      • createAccountButtonAction

        public void createAccountButtonAction()
        This method runs when the createAccountButton is clicked. If the information entered by the user is valid, it creates a new Employee object using the data that the user entered, sets the currentUser as the new Employee, and calls the addEmployeeToDatabase method with the new Employee. Otherwise it notifies the user of an error.

      • connectToDatabase

        private void connectToDatabase()
        This method connects to the database and saves that connection object as a field that can be used later.

      • loadProductLine

        private void loadProductLine()
        This method uses a database connection to get the products that are available for production and then adds those products to the observableProductLine ObservableArrayList and the contents of their toString() method to the observableProductStrings ObservableArrayList.

      • loadProductionLog

        private void loadProductionLog()
        This method uses a database connection to get information from the production record and creates ProductionRecord objects from that information. It them stores them in the productionRecord ArrayList.

      • loadEmployees

        private void loadEmployees()
        This method is used to load the employees ArrayList with Employee objects created from the EMPLOYEE table in the database.

      • addToProductionDB

        private void addToProductionDB(java.util.ArrayList<ProductionRecord> productionRun)
        This method is used to add a list of production records to the production record database table.
        Parameters:
        productionRun - An ArrayList containing the ProductionRecords to be added to the database

      • addEmployeeToDatabase

        private void addEmployeeToDatabase(Employee employee)
        This method adds the username, password, and email of an Employee object to the EMPLOYEE table in the database.
        Parameters:
        employee - The employee object who's details are to be added

      • setupProductLineTable

        private void setupProductLineTable()
        This method sets up the existingProducts table and the chooseProduct list and associates them with observable array lists containing the values that they need.

      • showProduction

        private void showProduction(java.util.ArrayList<ProductionRecord> productionRun)
        This method displays the production log to the production log text area.
        Parameters:
        productionRun - An ArrayList of all of the ProductionRecord that were created.

      • reversePassword

        private java.lang.String reversePassword(java.lang.String password)
        This method works recursively to reverse the password that is passed into it and returns the result.
        Parameters:
        password - The password that you want to reverse
        Returns:
        The reversed password

      • displayCurrentUser

        private void displayCurrentUser()
        This method is used to update the current user labels on all of the different tabs all at once.

      • testMultimedia

        private static void testMultimedia()
        This is a test class to demonstrate that the AudioPlayer and MoviePlayer classes are working properly.
